intro: Saussurea sinuata, commonly known as the Sinuous Saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of China, Mongolia, and Russia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and is often referred to as the sunflower family. The plant typically grows in alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and cool climates. Its flowering stems are often branched and can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with pale yellow to white ray flowers surrounding a central disc of tubular florets. Saussurea sinuata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
